primair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: God intervenes in a fallen, self-destructive world to establish a beachhead of peace through the Resurrection, transforming human toil from vanity into meaningful participation in His kingdom.

tekstueel_bewijs: the intervention of God to save us from self-destruction
He has taken away the sin of the world
By his death he has destroyed death

object.identificatie: Shalom / Biblical Peace (Power from on high)
tekstueel_bewijs: the peace that passes human understanding
I send the promise of my Father upon you
the mouth of the LORD hath spoken it
He gives us power from on high
clothed with power from on high
Our weapons in this warfare are Biblical
original and primordial rebellion against the Creator
the enemy is on the run
tegenstander.toelichting_ernst: Sin is described as an inescapable cycle of vanity and 'original rebellion' that unaided humankind cannot overcome.

secundair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The believer maintains a 'beachhead' in the world through specific ministries and endurance.
secundair_narratief_programma.subject: The Believer / Congregation
secundair_narratief_programma.toelichting_verhouding: The secondary program is explicitly dependent on the primary ('When you trust in the Lord, it is not sand poured in the river').

voorbeelden_god_subject: God has definitively changed the course of the world.
He has won the victory for us.
He gives us power from on high.
voorbeelden_mens_subject: We all know about the numerous atrocities.
Each of you has a beachhead.
They shall beat their swords into plowshares.

voorbeelden: chiefly are we bound to praise you
Maybe peace is really not what we want.
The apostles and evangelists knew what a figure of speech was.
Unaided humankind cannot lift itself up.
clothed with power from on high.

modale_analyse.modale_interpretatie: The sermon focuses on the lack of human power (incompetence) and the gift of divine power (competence) as the only solution to the cycle of sin.

semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.beweging_in_preek: Moves from ~S2 (Progress/Sentimentality) to S2 (The reality of the Fall/Vanity) to S1 (The Resurrection/Power).
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.theologische_resolutie: The tension is resolved by the 'intervention' of God (D-Day analogy) which breaks the cycle of S2.
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.ernst_van_s2: Extremely high; the preacher uses Ecclesiastes and the Khmer Rouge to prove human effort is futile.

diagnostische_evaluatie.classificatie_toelichting: The sermon is profoundly theocentric. It identifies the human condition as a 'moral wasteland' and positions God as the sole initiator of change.

indicatoren_moralisme.tekstueel_bewijs: It might be helping a sick neighbor...

indicatoren_genade.tekstueel_bewijs: Christ has destroyed death, and in his Resurrection, he has won the victory for us also.
original and primordial rebellion against the Creator

exemplarisme_check.beschrijving: Figures like Bishop Tutu and Bonhoeffer are used, but they are explicitly described as 'trusting the power from on high' rather than succeeding by their own will.
exemplarisme_check.alternatieve_lezing: The sermon already provides this by stating they are 'embodiments' of Christ's victory.

identificatie_patroon.effect_op_hoorder: Relief from the burden of self-salvation; empowerment through dependence.

narratieve_coherentie.coherentie_beschrijving: The transition from the 'vanity' of Ecclesiastes to the 'power' of the Gospel is seamless and structurally sound.
spanning_punten: The tension between 'peace' and the 'rush of adrenaline' is left somewhat unresolved except in the eschatological promise.

soteriologie.tekstueel_bewijs: The beachhead has been established, the enemy is on the run, the war is going to be won.

hamartologie.ernst_diagnose: Total inability: 'Unaided humankind cannot lift itself up'.

aanbevelingen.actantiele_audit_samenvatting: The sermon successfully maintains God as the Subject of the primary narrative program. Human action is correctly relegated to a secondary, responsive program.

modale_balans.voorgestelde_balans: Maintain as is; this is a classic grace structure.

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: This sermon is a masterclass in avoiding moralism by grounding human 'doing' in divine 'power from on high'.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retorische_analyse: A rhetorical analysis might focus on the effective use of the 'D-Day' metaphor; Greimas shows that this metaphor is the functional 'engine' that switches the Subject from Man to God.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_exegese: Exegesis would focus on the historical context of Micah; Greimas shows how Micah's 'Object' (Peace) is unattainable in the 'Ecclesiastes' system without a new 'Sender'.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_greimas: Reveals that the 'beachhead' examples (prison ministry, etc.) are not the main story but 'secondary programs' fueled by the primary 'Power' actant.

appendices.notities: The sermon uses the 'D-Day' analogy to perfectly illustrate the transition from the Axis of Power to the Axis of Transmission.
